required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Outcomes and Urodynamic Effects After Vaginal Tailored Mesh Surgery for Pelvic Organ Prolapse
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Outcomes and Urodynamic Effects After Vaginal Tailored Mesh Surgery for Pelvic Organ Prolapse

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the clinical outcome and urodynamic effect of two novel vaginal tailored mesh surgeries.

detailed_description.textblock: We will review the medical records (including medical data, urodynamic data, pad weight data, etc) of women who underwent either anterior or posterior novel vaginal tailored mesh surgeries at National Taiwan University Hospital between November 2011 and November 2013.

primary_outcome.description: Recurrence rate of cystocele, rectocele, uterine prolapse, or vaginal vault prolapse within 1 year after surgery

secondary_outcome.description: The change of pad weight between baseline and 3 months after surgery for pelvic organ prolapse

secondary_outcome.measure: The change of maximum urethral closure pressure
secondary_outcome.description: The difference of maximum urethral closure pressure between baseline and 3 months after surgery
Vaginal mesh erosion rate within 1 year after surgery

arm_group.description: Woman with cystocele who underwent anterior vaginal tailored mesh surgery
Woman with rectocele, enterocele, uterine prolapse, vaginal stump prolpase who underwent posterior vaginal tailored mesh surgery
Woman with cystocele and rectocele/uterine prolapse/vaginal vault prolapse/enterocele who underwent anterior and posterior vaginal tailored mesh surgery

intervention.description: Anterior vaginal tailored mesh surgery for repair of cystocele with or without stress urinary incontinence
Posterior vaginal tailored mesh surgery for repair of enterocele, rectocele, vaginal vault prolapse or uterine prolapse

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All women with pelvic organ prolapse who underwent either anterior or/and posterior vaginal tailored mesh surgeries in National Taiwan University Hospital between November 2011 and November 2013
Exclusion Criteria: nil

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology, National Taiwan University Hospital

facility.name: Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology, National Taiwan University Hospital

clinical_study.keyword: pelvic organ prolapse, vaginal mesh, urodynamic studies
